name: Conditioned log, hardwood, green, at veneer mill, E
description:
All weights given on an ovendry basis. All moisture contents are on an ovendry basis.  MC% =(weight of water in wood / weight of oven dry wood) *100. Reference to specific gravities use oven dry mass and volumes at specified moisture contents.  Reference to densities use mass and volume at specified moistrue contents.

Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Questionnaires from  4 veneer and 5 flooring mills in the E. United States representing 32 states.
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: E= Eastern US United States. The states included MN, IA, MO, WI, IL, NJ, OH, IN, MI, WV, PA, MD, DW, NJ, NY, ME, VT, NH, RI, MA, CT, VA, KY, AR, LA, MS, AL, FL,GA, NC, SC, and TN

exchanges.description: Based on a weighted average green density and specific gravity of 944 kg/m3 and 0.510. 2.46 M3 = 1255 KG  Moisture content (ovendry basis) = 85%.

flow.name: Conditioned log, hardwood, green, at veneer mill, E

exchanges.description: Amount of heat consumed on-site from burning wood and fossil fuels  during block conditioning. Represents 28.7% mill use of heat

flow.name: Heat, block conditiong, at veneer mill, E

exchanges.description: Amount of diesel consumed during conditioning.  Represents 5% of mill use of diesel
Amount of electricity consumed during conditions.  Represents 2.4% of mill use of electricity.
Amount of natural gas consumed during conditioning.  Represents 14.3% of mill use of natural gas; proxy for propane

flow.name: Natural gas, combusted in industrial equipment

exchanges.description: Amount of gasoline consumed during conditioning.  Represents 14.3% of mill use of gasoline.
Live steam used to heat vats for conditioning logs; Represents 50% of mill use of surface water.
Live steam used to heat vats for conditioning logs; Represents 50% of mill use of well water.
Based on a weighted average green density and specific gravity of 944 kg/m3 and 0.510. 2.46 M3 = 1255 KG  Moisture content (ovendry basis) = 85%.

flow.name: Bucked and debarked log, hardwood, green, at veneer mill, E
